name: Example
description: An example provided by Garrit that introduces us to motion and rotation in p5 generative art.

name: Flower
description: A live coding example provided by Bassima that uses rectangles to create petals and for loops to create repetition, resulting in a flower shape.

name: Vera Molnar Squares
description: A recreation of an artwork by Vera Molnar, as demonstrated by Garrit. A grid is used with squares that overlap each other and become smaller as it reaches the center. The squares have an asymmetry and slight variation to them using variance.

name: Perlin Noise Landscape
description: An example from Garrit that demonstrates the use of Perlin noise and noiseSeeds. Multiple small lines are drawn from one point to another on the x-axis using a for loop and are given pseudorandom points on the y-axis using Math.random. This results in a natural landscape effect.

name: Perlin Noise Depth
description: Another example from Garrit showing how Perlin noise can be used to create depth and shading. Points are scattered with varying sizes, allowing for a visual effect that looks almost 3d while remaining in 2d.

name: Perlin Noise Smoke
description: Final noise example from Garrit that animates the same points from noise_02 and allows for fluidity on the canvas, emulating the moving nature of smoke or clouds.
